tweets.content:
Pricing of small marketcap coins is pretty simple, you donâ€™t need a Stanford degree to figure it out:
- Have Binance perp = $10m basic manipulation value
- memecoin = $3m basic exit liquidity value over retails
- have coinbase spot = $5m basic liquidity value from USA market
- have Upbit KRW spot = $10m basic liquidity value from Korean apes

So if a coin is a memecoin and have Binance perp, its intrinsic value = ~$13m

If itâ€™s a coin with Coinbase spot + Upbit KRW spot + binance perp, its intrinsic value is $25m

Buy when it falls below its intrinsic value, sell when some cabal starts the run.

tweets.author: Vida_BWE

tweets.content:
In my opinion, the safest trade in crypto right now is the SOL/XRP rate ratio trade. I've entered $1m of this position as a long-term investment to manage some of my spare funds in crypto since yields elsewhere are so low right now. I plan to hold this position for about 1-2 years.

Buy SOL spot > use as collateral of USDT perp > short XRP with the same dollar value.

thesis: XRP is 2x marketcap of SOL, but be like 10% of Solana's utility or even less, XRP is more like an American Dream memecoin. In the long run, the price would match the intrinsic value of the coin and I'm betting on SOL will flip XRP.

Disclaimer:
I'm fine with losing 50% of my position value and I'm ok to hold this position for 1-2 years. Do your own research and don't be reckless.

tweets.content:
Crypto is still the easiest financial market for a smart guy to make it. But if you are expecting the 2021 type of alt season, youâ€™ll have to wait for couple years for another 2001,2008,2020-like major crisis/event to occur first, then the worldâ€™s fed will start their super sonic money printer > fiats depreciates drastically > a new era of easy money comes. Then weâ€™ll have another great cycle of speculation&gamble.

But before then, you should survive& grind on your tools and skills and connections, also learn more about macro cycles and AI.

The BSC hot wave recently also gives opportunities for some grinders to make banks. Just need to make a tool that tracks CZ&heyiâ€™s posts and enters the trade fast within 1 minute. The grinders are still getting rewarded. A news trader chigga made $3m on sniping MUBARAK at the first CZ tweet couple days ago, made me envy him as fuck, showing there are still exit liquidities that you can farm on. 

There wonâ€™t be altseason for couple years but there will be continuous rotating events/narritives/PVP frenzy that you can participate in.

tweets.content:
To extend, the kind of normies/information I tend to block on my information flow are:

- High-leverage gamblers

- Memecoin gamblers. This means they trade memes for gambling purposes without any external advantage against other market participants. Note: gamblers are different from good informed elite on-chain traders.

- TA trader that trade only based on TA (they exit/enters position by only looking chart with eyes and with 0 external info)

- normies that blame the market after they took a great loss
tweets.author: Vida_BWE

tweets.content:
good active traders I know mostly experienced only small drawdowns over the past month, and about half of them reached all-time high in net worth. (especially after the Trump shill trade couple days ago)

Spend time engaging with skilled elite traders, and keep your information flow timeline clean, by avoiding or blocking normiesâ€”simple.

tweets.author: Vida_BWE

tweets.content:
Everyone being giga bullish on a project before its launch usually means that it won't be a great long trade.

I am thinking about stuff like Monad, EigenLayer, Berachain

The huge upside has been captured in the private market.
Then it launches at high valuation, and the only thing you can do is provide exit liquidity for all the people that got in on the private market.

Think about the highest ROI tokens we've had, ever.

They have never been giga hyped before launch, right ?

Then of course, this all depends on launch valuations. Hyped projects that launch in shitty conditions could become good longs ( $ZRO, $ZK ?). But a general rule for me is that overhyped projects won't give interesting upside.

tweets.content: The best way to enter/exit a position in a short period of time: Execute your trade in one shot on all the exchanges that are available, on both spot and perp, with the same price limit on the same millisecond. Leave no opportunity for market makers to take advantage of.

tweets.content: You'll end up paying much higher slippage with market makers thinner the book and stat arb guys front run your incoming predictable orders.
tweets.author: Vida_BWE

tweets.content: The worst way to enter/exit a position in short intervals: TWAP in a constant size + constant interval. The market maker will be able to detect your intention of getting in/out by analyzing transactions, and they know you have the willingness to pay high trade slippage.
tweets.author: Vida_BWE
